title: Russian 'pick-up artist' accused of secretly filming women in Ghana
content: Ghana has called on Russia to extradite the man, who is accused of recording sexual encounters without consent.

originalTitle: Planned US-funded baby vaccine trial in Guinea-Bissau blasted by WHO
title: Planned US-funded baby vaccine trial in Guinea-Bissau blasted by WHO
content: Giving some newborns in Guinea-Bissau an established hepatitis B treatment but not others is "unethical", it says.

originalTitle: Kenyans drop flowers for Valentine's bouquets of cash. Not everyone is impressed
title: Kenyans drop flowers for Valentine's bouquets of cash. Not everyone is impressed
content: Bouquets of cash have been blooming in popularity in Kenya but recent warnings may slow the trend.

originalTitle: At least 11 Palestinians killed in Israeli attacks across Gaza
title: Big News! A Special Team for Peace is Starting!
content:
Hello, Super Friends!

Hello, hello, little explorers and mighty thinkers! It’s your friendly news reporter from Africa, here to share some super exciting news from far, far away! Imagine a world where everyone is friends, where there are no arguments, and everyone shares their toys and smiles. Sounds wonderful, right? Well, that's what we call peace! And today, we have some happy news about a big step towards making more peace in our world.

Meet President Trump

In a big country called America, there is a very important leader. He is like the head teacher of the whole country, or the captain of a very big team! His name is President Donald Trump. He has a very important job: to help make his country and the world a better, safer place for everyone. Just like your teachers or parents help you stay safe and happy, a President works to do that for many, many people.

Did you know? The President of a country lives in a very special house called the White House! It has many rooms and a big garden. It’s where important decisions are made!

What is a 'Board of Peace'?

President Trump has thought of a super clever idea! He wants to make sure there is more peace, and less fighting, in the world. So, he has created a brand-new team! This team is called the 'Board of Peace'. Imagine you have a special club at school, and everyone in the club works together to make playtime fun for everyone, or to make sure no one feels left out. That's a little bit like what this 'Board of Peace' will do! This Board is a group of very smart people. They will all come together to talk and think about the best ways to bring peace to different places. They want to find solutions to problems, so that people can live happily together, just like you learn to solve problems with your friends at school when you disagree about a game. They will talk about sharing, understanding, and being kind.

Why is Peace So Important?

Think about your own life. When you are playing with your friends, do you like it when everyone is happy and sharing? Or do you like it when there are arguments and someone is sad? Of course, you like happy playtime! Peace is just like that, but for big countries and lots of people. When there is peace, children can go to school safely, families can live without fear, and everyone can work together to build a better future. Peace means a quiet time, a happy time, a time for growing and learning and playing. When there is peace, people can help each other. They can share their food, their ideas, and their toys (if they're kids!). It makes everyone feel safe and loved. Peace helps flowers grow, birds sing, and children laugh. It's truly a wonderful thing!

Did you know? The symbol for peace is often a dove, a beautiful white bird. It flies freely and gently, just like we want peace to spread around the world!

The Big Meeting is Coming!

So, this very important 'Board of Peace' team is getting ready for their first-ever meeting! President Trump has announced that this special meeting will happen very, very soon. It will take place on Thursday! Imagine everyone sitting around a big table, with their listening ears on and their thinking caps ready, all focused on one big goal: peace! They will gather to talk about all the big and small ways they can help make the world a more peaceful place. It’s like the first day of your new school club, where you all plan what fun things you will do together. This meeting will be the start of many important talks and plans to help people around the world live in harmony.

What Will They Talk About?

At this meeting, the people on the 'Board of Peace' will probably share their ideas. Maybe one person will talk about how to help children in places where there has been trouble. Another might talk about how different countries can learn to be better friends. They might discuss how to share resources, like water or food, fairly so that everyone has enough. They will brainstorm new ideas, just like you brainstorm ideas for a new drawing or a new game. They want to find the best solutions to help stop arguments between big groups of people. They will think about how to teach everyone that being kind and understanding is much better than fighting. Their goal is to help everyone feel safe and happy, no matter where they live.

Did you know? The rainbow is sometimes seen as a symbol of peace, because it shows many beautiful colours coming together side-by-side!

How Can YOU Help Make Peace?

Even though you are young, you are super important in making peace too! You can start right in your own home and at your school. How? By sharing your toys, by being kind to your friends, by listening when someone is talking, and by helping others when they are sad. If you see two friends arguing, you can try to help them find a way to be friends again. Every little act of kindness helps build a bigger, more peaceful world. Remember, peace starts with you! When you choose to be friendly and understanding, you are helping to make the world a happier place, one smile at a time. So, let’s all cheer for President Trump’s new 'Board of Peace' and do our part to spread kindness everywhere! Thank you for listening, little leaders! Until next time, keep shining bright! Your Africa Reporter, signing off!
summary: US President Donald Trump has created a special 'Board of Peace' team, and their first big meeting to talk about how to bring more peace to the world will happen on Thursday.
whyMatters: This is important because when people work together for peace, it means fewer fights, more friends, and a happier world where everyone feels safe to play and learn.
